explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning (ML) models for assessing PV module performance and degradation.
explanations.deep learning: The paper mentions deep learning (DL) models as part of data-driven analytic methods for processing large datasets related to PV degradation.
explanations.classification: The paper highlights the use of ML and DL for the classification of PV degradation signatures.
explanations.feature extraction: The paper reviews studies that involve feature extraction mechanisms for analyzing PV degradation.
explanations.neural network: The paper refers to neural networks as part of the data-driven techniques used in PV degradation analysis.
explanations.representation learning: The paper implies the use of representation learning in processing voluminous data with vast features.
explanations.hidden layer: Neural networks, which include hidden layers, are mentioned as part of the models used for PV degradation analysis.
explanations.convolutional neural network: CNN is implied as one of the deep learning models used for processing imaging data features of PV modules.
explanations.CNN: CNN is implied as one of the deep learning models used for processing imaging data features of PV modules.
explanations.recurrent neural network: RNN is implied as one of the deep learning models used for processing sequential data related to PV degradation.
explanations.long short-term memory: LSTM is implied as one of the deep learning models used for processing sequential data related to PV degradation.
explanations.LSTM: LSTM is implied as one of the deep learning models used for processing sequential data related to PV degradation.
